title: The largest lakes in the U.S. in 2003 , by area
summary: This is a bar chart representing Lakes In The Us in the x axis and Area in square miles in the y axis.
Lakes In The Us Lake Superior has the highest Area in square miles and Rainy Lake has the lowest Area in square miles.
The highest Lakes In The Us Lake Superior has 31355.0 more Area in square miles than the lowest Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Area in square miles for 20 number of Lakes In The Uss.
The Area in square miles is appeared to be the highest at Lakes In The Us Lake Superior and lowest at Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Lakes In The Us in the x axis and Area in square miles in the y axis.
Lakes In The Us Lake Superior has the highest Area in square miles and Rainy Lake has the lowest Area in square miles.
The highest Lakes In The Us Lake Superior has 31355.0 more Area in square miles than the lowest Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Lakes In The Us, and Area in square miles in each Lakes In The Us on the y axis.
The Area in square miles is highest at Lakes In The Us Lake Superior and lowest at Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake.
The second highest Area in square miles is appeared to be the Lakes In The Us Lake Huron.
There is a difference of 31355.0 between the maximum Lakes In The Us Lake Superior and minimum Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake.
Lakes In The Us Lake Superior is higher than any other Lakes In The Uss with value 31700.0, followed by Lake Huron, and Lake Michigan. Down to Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake with the lowest value 345.0.
The Lakes In The Us Rainy Lake has 6.06 times less Area in square miles than average.
Summing up the values of all Lakes In The Uss, we get total 104653.0.
